examples: She gave him a curious look.
Ela lhe deu um olhar curioso.

suggested: Why did the tomato turn red? Because it saw the salad dressing! (You gotta have a sharp look to catch that one.)
Feeling sad and helpless as you watch someone you love suffer and decline, unable to do anything to help them.
Feeling angry and frustrated at someone who refuses to listen or acknowledge your perspective, or who dismisses your concerns without a second look.
It can be surprising to realize how much you can learn and discover about yourself and the world by taking a closer look at the people, places, and things around you.
The olfactory experience of taking a deep sniff and discovering the complex and subtle aromas of different foods, flowers, and environments.
The tactile experience of touching different textures and surfaces, from smooth glass to rough sandpaper.
The connection to others and the world around you that comes from truly seeing and understanding the people and places you encounter.
